status: Imperial political structure (comprising British India, a quasi-federation of presidencies and provinces directly governed by the British Crown through the Viceroy and Governor-General of India and Princely States, governed by Indian rulers, under the suzerainty of The British Crown exercised through the Viceroy of India) Interpretation Act 1889 (52 & 53 Vict. c. 63), s. 18.
religion: Hinduism, Islam, Christianity, Sikhism, Buddhism, Jainism, Zoroastrianism, Judaism
